ingredients.name: placeholder
ingredients.description: start ingredients at 1 instead of 0.

ingredients.name: Sichuan Peppercorn
ingredients.description: The tongue-numbing citrus-scented berry of a Chinese prickly ash tree.
facts: Native to Sichuan Province, China
Cultivated throughout Asia
Pairs well with citrus, ginger, and anything in the anise family
Ground sichuan peppercorn is a key ingredient in five-spice powder
It is also used in Nepali and Tibetan cuisine, and other cuisines from the Himalayas

ingredients.name: Cayenne
ingredients.description: The all-purpose hot chili commonly found in Western hot sauce.
facts: Native to French Guiana, Central and South America
Cultivated in Mexico, Africa, India, and Louisiana
Cayenne is a medium to high-heat chili with sweet-and-sour notes, dusty overtones, and a great orange color
Most types of cayenne peppers range from 30,000 to 50,000 scoville units

ingredients.name: Monosodium Glutamate
ingredients.description: A flavor enhancer with an umami taste that intensifies the meaty, savory flavor of food
facts: MSG was first prepared in 1908 by Japanese biochemist Kikunae Ikeda, who was trying to isolate and duplicate the savory taste of kombu
MSG occurs naturally in tomatoes and cheese
Ajinomoto is the Japanese company that originally made and sold MSG to Japanese consumers
Aji-no-moto means 'essence of taste' in Japanese

ingredients.name: Popping Corn
ingredients.description: A variety of corn kernel which expands and puffs up when heated.
facts: Popcorn is one of the six major types of corn
The others are dent corn, pod corn, flour corn, flint corn, and sweet corn
The outer hull pops at approximately 135 psi and 180 C
The first commercial popcorn machine was invented in Chicago in 1885
Nebraska produces 250 million pounds of popcorn per year

ingredients.name: Chia Seeds
ingredients.description: A mild-flavored seed with exciting hydrophilic behaviour.
facts: Native to Mexico and the Southwestern United States
Cultivated throughout Central and South America
Chia seeds absorb up to 12 times their weight in liquid when soaked, and develop a mucilaginous coating
Exceptionally good at getting stuck in the spaces between your teeth

ingredients.name: Flax Seeds
ingredients.description: A small, nutty, oily seed that can add crunch to oatmeal and bread
facts: Flax seeds come in both brown and golden varieties
Flax seeds are used to produce linseed oil, which is often used in woodworking
Linen is the fabric made from flax fibers
The meal left from oil production is added to cattle feed as a protein supplement
One of the steps in producing flax fiber is called heckling

ingredients.name: Millet
ingredients.description: A family of versatile cereals eaten around the world
facts: Millet was domesticated multiple times across the world
As a result, millet species vary widely around the world
India produces about one third of the world's millet
Millets are major food sources in arid and semiarid regions, where they grow more reliably than other cereals
In the United States millet is mainly used for bird seed

ingredients.name: Pecans
ingredients.description: A rich, buttery nut often used in sweet desserts
facts: The commercial growing of pecans in the United States did not start until the 1880s
The US and Mexico account for 93% of global pecan production
Pecans grow best where summers are long, hot, and humid
The pecan is one of four California state nuts, along with almond, pistachio, and walnut

ingredients.name: Bulgur Wheat
ingredients.description: A crushed, parboiled wheat grain with a nutty flavor
facts: Bulgur is made from cracked whole-grain kernels of wheat that are parboiled before packaging
It is different from wheat berries, which are packaged whole and raw, and freekeh, which is cracked but uncooked young green wheat kernels
Bulgur is often made from durum wheat
Bulgur does not need to be cooked, merely soaked
You may have eaten bulgur in tabbouleh or kibbeh
Bulgur comes in various grades, distinguished by particle size

ingredients.name: Dutched Cocoa Powder
ingredients.description: Cocoa powder that has been washed with an alkaline solution to neutralize its natural acidity
facts: While natural cocoa powder has a pH around 5.5, dutched cocoa powder's pH is usually between 6.8 and 8.1
The alkalization process reduces bitterness and improves solubility
The Droste effect is named for the packaging of a Dutch brand of cocoa powder, Droste's Cacao
The Droste effect is when a picture appears recursively inside itself

ingredients.name: Powdered Sugar
ingredients.description: A mix of finely ground sugar and cornstarch, designed to dissolve quickly and without caking
facts: Before sugar was widely available in granulated form, it came in cakes or cones
Chefs would then grate it to the desired size
Powdered sugar can come from either cane or beet sugar
Sugar cane is thousands of years old, while sugar beets were only developed in the mid 18th century in Prussia

ingredients.name: Marshmallow
ingredients.description: A puffy white candy made out of sugar, water, and gelatin
facts: Marshmallows were originally made by whipping the sap of the mallow plant with sugar
Later confectioners in France replaced the mallow sap with gelatin and corn starch, making the marshmallow we know today
Most marshmallows are made using an extrusion process developed in the late 1940s
Marshmallows are fluffed by being pumped through a blender while air is being pumped in

ingredients.name: Milk Powder
ingredients.description: A shelf-stable, lightweight form of milk often used in candy, baked goods, and infant formula.
facts: Partially drying milk gives evaporated milk, also known as unsweetened condensed milk
The flavors and fat content in the original milk significantly impact the flavor of the powder; so does the drying method
Adding milk powder to baked goods can add extra smoothness and sweetness
Baker's dry milk powder has been heated extra during drying to denature some enzymes that interfere with gluten formation

ingredients.name: Raisins
ingredients.description: A super-sweet dried grape commonly used in baking
facts: There is a distinction between a sultana (a golden raisin) and a raisin (a dark raisin) in the UK, Ireland, New Zealand, and Australia
Raisins are traditionally sun-dried, either on the vine or on trays
Oatmeal raisin cookies are a polarizing topic
Oatmeal raisin chocolate chip cookies can break up even the strongest friendships

ingredients.name: Barberries
ingredients.description: A small, sharply-flavored sour fruit commonly used in Persian cooking.
facts: Zereshk in Persian
Grows in the wild in Europe and West Asia
Two related species are found in Argentina and Chile
The stem, root, and bark can be used to make a yellow dye

ingredients.name: Almonds
ingredients.description: The sweet, soft seed of the almond tree, often used in sweets and cakes
facts: Native to Iran and surrounding countries
Technically it's a drupe, not a nut
Almond production in California is concentrated in the Central Valley
A single almond takes 1.1 gallons of water to grow--but almond milk is still more sustainable than cow milk
There is a recessive gene in almonds that controls bitterness
Bitter almonds also contain chemicals that form cyanide in the presence of water

ingredients.name: Shredded Coconut
ingredients.description: The sweet meat of the coconut seed, which has been shredded and then dried
facts: Every part of the coconut has a use, from the inside of the fruit to the fibrous husks to their leaves and trunks
If you were stuck on a deserted island, a coconut tree would be an excellent resource!
Coconut shells have three indentations that look like a face
Like almonds, coconuts are drupes and not true nuts

ingredients.name: Dark Brown Sugar
ingredients.description: Sugar containing molasses, which creates a rich caramel flavor
facts: Brown sugar can be produced by refining sugar and adding back molasses, or by not fully refining sugar
In the late 19th century the refined white sugar industry ran a smear campaign against brown sugar
The result was a perception that brown sugar was inferior in quality and likely to be infested by insects
Natural brown sugars have many names, including muscovado, jaggery, turbinado, and demerara

ingredients.name: Sunflower Seeds
ingredients.description: The hulled seed of the sunflower, often used as a carrier for salt and flavor
facts: Did you know you can buy pickle flavored sunflower seeds?
Sunflowers tilt during the day to face the sun, but stop when they begin blooming
Ukraine and Russia each produce a quarter of the world's sunflower seeds
Sunflower hulls contain compounds that make them toxic to grasses and most garden plants

ingredients.name: Oats
facts: Steel cut oats are oat inners (groats) which were broken during the dehulling process
Steel cut oats retain a portion of the bran layer
Rolled oats are dehusked, steamed, rolled between heavy rollers, and then lightly toasted
Oats grow best in temperate regions
Oats have a greater tolerance of rain than other cereals, so they can be grown in places with cool, wet summers

ingredients.name: Cloves
ingredients.description: A powerfully scented dried flower bud
facts: A member of the myrtle family
Adult clove trees grow 26-39 feet tall
The Dutch monopolized the trade of cloves from the seventeenth century on
In the late 1700s a Frenchman named Pierre Poivre brought stolen clove seedlings to France (and then to Zanzibar) and set up competition with the Dutch
The compound responsible for the aroma of cloves is called eugenol

ingredients.name: Orange peel
ingredients.description: Citrus sinensis
facts: The orange is a hybrid between pomelo and mandarin
Brazil produces about a quarter of the world's oranges
Bergamot oranges are a hybrid between bitter oranges and lemons, and the peel is used to produce perfumes and Earl Grey tea
Pith thickness varies widely between orange cultivars
The outer skin of an orange, often called the zest, is also called the exocarp or the flavedo

ingredients.name: Ginger
ingredients.description: A fragrant, peppery spice made from a knobby rhizome
facts: The spicy compound in ginger is called gingerol
Cultivated in India, China, Japan, Indonesia, Nigeria, Jamaica, and various islands of the West Indies
Native to China
Ginger is related to turmeric, cardamom, and galangal
India produces a third of the world's ginger
Ginger juice can be used to curdle milk at 158 Fahrenheit, making ginger milk curd--like tofu, but gingery

ingredients.name: Star Anise
ingredients.description: A sweet, licorice-scented spice made from distinct eight-pointed fruits
facts: Native to China and Vietnam
Star anise contains anethole, the same compound that gives the unrelated anise its flavor
About 90% of the world's star anise crop is used for extraction of shikimic acid, a chemical intermediate used in the synthesis of Tamiflu
The related japanese star anise tree is highly toxic
Star anise is a key flavor in five-spice powder and pho

ingredients.name: Cinnamon
ingredients.description: Warm spices made from the barks of young tree stems
facts: The trees are grown for multiple years, then chopped down to stumps that push up bushy new shoots from the base
After the rainy season these shoots are cut
The outer bark is scraped off and discarded, and the inner bark carefully pulled off into rolls
The essential oil in cinnamon is called cinnamaldehyde
99% of the world's cinnamon is grown in Indonesia, China, Vietnam and Sri Lanka
